SYSTEM: 05_OWL.pdf: Página 67
© O. Corcho, MC Suárez de Figueroa Baonza
47
OWL 2
Named Classes (I)
An ontology contains classes – indeed, the main building blocks of an
OWL ontology are classes.
An empty ontology contains one class called Thing.
OWL classes are interpreted as sets of individuals or sets of objects.
The class Thing is the class that represents the set containing all
individuals.
Because of this all classes are subclasses of Thing.
speaker: SYSTEM
